00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Functions for writing and reading EEPROM on the 10mm nRF9E5 layer.
00031  * See nrf9e5.h for documentation on this library and functions.
00032  *
00033  * @file nrf9e5.c
00034  * @date 27-Jan-2010
00035  * @author Se√°n Harte
00036  ******************************************************************************/

00038 
00039 #include <stdio.h>
00040 #include <stdlib.h>
00041 #include <string.h>
00042 #include "common.h"
00043 #include "nrf9e5.h"
00044 #include "ftSpi.h"
00045 #include "crc16.h"

00047 
00048 /* Instructions for 25320 EEPROM */
00049 #define WREN_INSTR          0x06        /* 0000X110 */
00050 #define WRDI_INSTR          0x04        /* 0000X100 */
00051 #define RDSR_INSTR          0x05        /* 0000X101 */
00052 #define WRSR_INSTR          0x01        /* 0000X001 */
00053 #define READ_INSTR          0x03        /* 0000X011 */
00054 #define WRITE_INSTR         0x02        /* 0000X010 */
00055 
00056 /* Status reg bits in 25320 EEPROM */
00057 #define nRDY                0x01        /* 00000001 */
00058 
00059 /* Bitmasks for 1st byte the nRF9E5 expects in EEPROM */
00060 #define NRF_SLOW_EEPROM     0x00        /* xxxx0xxx */
00061 #define NRF_FAST_EEPROM     0x08        /* xxxx1xxx */
00062 #define NRF_XO_FREQ_4MHZ    0x00        /* xxxxx000 */
00063 #define NRF_XO_FREQ_8MHZ    0x01        /* xxxxx001 */
00064 #define NRF_XO_FREQ_12MHZ   0x02        /* xxxxx010 */
00065 #define NRF_XO_FREQ_16MHZ   0x03        /* xxxxx011 */
00066 #define NRF_XO_FREQ_20MHZ   0x04        /* xxxxx100 */
00067 
00068 #define MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE  7
00069 #define MEMORY_SIZE         8192
00070 #define MEMORY_PAGE_MASK    0x1F
00071 #define MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE    0x20
00072 #define MEMORY_CODE_SIZE    4096 - MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE
00073 
00074 /** Delay after writing to memory **/
00075 #define DELAY_WRITE         10
00076 
00077 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to the chip select. **/
00078 #define PIN_NCS_10MM        0x40
00079 
00080 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to the SPI clock. **/
00081 #define PIN_SCK_10MM        0x04
00082 
00083 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to MISO. **/
00084 #define PIN_MISO_10MM       0x08
00085 
00086 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to MOSI. **/
00087 #define PIN_MOSI_10MM       0x10
00088 
00089 
00090 /** Frequency of crystal oscillator in Mhz. **/
00091 static uint32_t crystalFreq;
00092 
00093 /** Structure storing details of this EEPROM programmer. **/
00094 static spiDeviceInfo_t info = {
00095     DESC_10MM_PROG,                     /* Description. */
00096     PIN_NCS_10MM,                       /* nCS pin. */
00097     PIN_SCK_10MM,                       /* SCK pin. */
00098     PIN_MISO_10MM,                      /* MISO pin. */
00099     PIN_MOSI_10MM,                      /* MOSI pin. */
00100     FTSPI_MAX_BAUDRATE,                 /* Baud rate.  */
00101     MEMORY_SIZE,                        /* Memory Size. */
00102     MEMORY_CODE_SIZE,                   /* Code Size. */
00103     {{0, 0}, {0, 0}, {0, 0}, {0, 0}},   /* Write addresses (set later). */
00104     nrf_write,
00105     nrf_read,
00106     nrf_erase,
00107     nrf_addHeader,
00108 };
00109 
00110 
00111 /* Local function prototypes. */
00112 static void writeToEepromPage(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t start,
00113                               uint32_t end);
00114

00116 /*******************************************************************************
00117  * Functions that can be used externally. Documentation in nrf9e5.h.
00118  */
00119 
00120 
00121 spiDeviceInfo_t* nrf_init(uint32_t freq)
00122 {
00123     crystalFreq = freq;
00124     ftSpi_init(&info);
00125 
00126     return &info;
00127 }
00128 
00129 
00130 void nrf_write(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00131 {
00132     static bool isCalled = false;
00133     uint32_t end = address + size - 1;
00134     uint32_t pageEnd = address | (MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE - 1);
00135     uint8_t lastPageData[MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE];
00136 
00137     /* Check parameters are within limits of EEPROM */
00138     if ((address + size) > MEMORY_SIZE) {
00139         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Cannot write to address %u of %u byte memory\n",
00140                 end, MEMORY_SIZE);
00141         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00142     }
00143 
00144     memset(lastPageData, 0xFF, MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE);
00145     
00146     /*
00147      * Write to 1 page at a time. Sometimes there is a problem with writing to
00148      * the last page. So always a full page write is done, twice...
00149      */
00150     for (; address <= end; pageEnd += MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE) {
00151         if (pageEnd >= end) {
00152             memmove(lastPageData, data, (end & MEMORY_PAGE_MASK) + 1);
00153             writeToEepromPage(lastPageData, address, pageEnd);
00154             writeToEepromPage(lastPageData, address, pageEnd);
00155         }
00156         else {
00157             writeToEepromPage(data, address, pageEnd);
00158         }
00159         data += pageEnd - address + 1;
00160         address = pageEnd + 1;
00161     }
00162     if (!isCalled) {
00163         printf("\nWARNING: The board must be manually reset for the new program to run\n\n");
00164     }
00165     isCalled = true;
00166 }
00167 
00168 
00169 void nrf_erase(void)
00170 {
00171     uint8_t buffer[MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE];
00172     uint32_t i;
00173 
00174     memset(buffer, 0xFF, MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE);
00175 
00176     for (i = 0; i < (MEMORY_SIZE / MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE); ++i) {
00177         writeToEepromPage(buffer,
00178                           i * MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE,
00179                           ((i + 1) * MEMORY_PAGE_SIZE) - 1);
00180     }
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00184 void nrf_read(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00185 {
00186     uint8_t outData[size + 3];
00187     uint8_t inData[size + 3];
00188 
00189     /* Check for invalid parameters */
00190     if ((address + size) > MEMORY_SIZE) {
00191         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: EEPROM size too big (%u) at %s.\n",
00192                 size, stripPath(LOC));
00193         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00194     }
00195 
00196     memset(outData, 0xFF, size + 3);
00197 
00198     /* Setup read instruction and 2-byte address */
00199     outData[0] = READ_INSTR;
00200     outData[1] = getHighByte(address);
00201     outData[2] = getLowByte(address);
00202 
00203     ftSpi_readWrite(inData, outData, size + 3, true);
00204     memmove(data, inData + 3, size);
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 void nrf_addHeader(uint8_t* data, uint32_t rawCodeSize, bool isSupportReprog)
00209 {
00210     uint32_t numBlocks;
00211     uint32_t freq;
00212     uint32_t size = rawCodeSize + MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE;
00213     uint32_t i;
00214     FILE* file;
00215 
00216     /* Check there's enough room to add the header */
00217     if (rawCodeSize > MEMORY_CODE_SIZE) {
00218         fprintf(stderr,
00219                 "ERROR: EEPROM size too big (%u bytes). Max is %u bytes.\n",
00220                 rawCodeSize, MEMORY_CODE_SIZE);
00221         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00222     }
00223 
00224     freq = (crystalFreq / 4);
00225     if (freq == 0 || freq > 5) {
00226         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Invalid crystal frequency(%u)\n", crystalFreq);
00227         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00228     }
00229     freq -= 1;
00230 
00231     /* How many 256 byte blocks in program */
00232     numBlocks = size / 256;
00233     if (size % 256 != 0) {
00234         numBlocks++;
00235     }
00236 
00237     /* Calculate CRC-16 value for program code */
00238     crc16_init();
00239     for (i = 0; i < rawCodeSize; i++) {
00240         crc16_update(data[i]);
00241     }
00242 
00243     /* Shift bytes */
00244     memmove(data + MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE, data, rawCodeSize);
00245 
00246     /* Add configuration bytes */
00247     data[0] = NRF_FAST_EEPROM | freq;
00248     data[1] = MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE;
00249     data[2] = numBlocks - 1;        /* Don't include 1st block */
00250     data[3] = getLowByte(rawCodeSize);
00251     data[4] = getHighByte(rawCodeSize);
00252     data[5] = getLowByte(crc16_read());
00253     data[6] = getHighByte(crc16_read());
00254 
00255     info.writeAdds[0][0] = 0;
00256     info.writeAdds[0][1] = size;
00257 
00258     /* Create a file and write the data with header to it. */
00259     if ((file = fopen("nrf9e5_out.bin", "wb")) == NULL) {
00260         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: could not open file nrf9e5_out.bin.\n");
00261         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00262     }
00263     if (size != fwrite(data, 1, size, file)) {
00264         fprintf(stderr,
00265                 "ERROR: could not write %i bytes to nrf9e5_out.bin at %s.\n",
00266                 size, stripPath(LOC));
00267         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00268     }
00269     fclose(file);
00270 
00271     if (isSupportReprog) {
00272         /* Copy to upper half of memory */
00273         memmove(data + (MEMORY_SIZE / 2), data,
00274                                               rawCodeSize + MEMORY_HEADER_SIZE);
00275         info.writeAdds[1][0] = (MEMORY_SIZE / 2);
00276         info.writeAdds[1][1] = info.writeAdds[0][1];
00277     }
00278 }
00279 
00280 
00281 /*******************************************************************************
00282  * Functions that be only used within file.
00283  */
00284 
00285 
00286 /**
00287  * Writes a number of bytes to the EEPROM. Can only write within a single page.
00288  * There is a pause after writing to make sure the data is written before
00289  * sending the next command.
00290  *
00291  * @param data pointer to bytes to write.
00292  * @param start where to start writing to.
00293  * @param end where to finish writing to.
00294  **/
00295 static void writeToEepromPage(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t start, uint32_t end)
00296 {
00297     uint32_t size = end - start + 1;
00298     uint8_t* outData;
00299 
00300     if (NULL == (outData = (uint8_t*)malloc(end - start + 1 + 3))) {
00301         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00302                 end - start + 1 + 3, LOC);
00303         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00304     }
00305 
00306     /* Send WREN instruction */
00307     outData[0] = WREN_INSTR;
00308     ftSpi_readWrite(NULL, outData, 1, true);
00309 
00310     /* Setup data to send: instruction + address + data */
00311     outData[0] = WRITE_INSTR;
00312     outData[1] = getHighByte(start);
00313     outData[2] = getLowByte(start);
00314     memmove(outData + 3, data, size);
00315 
00316     /* Send data plus 3 bytes for intruction and address */
00317     ftSpi_readWrite(NULL, outData, size + 3, true);
00318 
00319     /* Faster to wait than to check the status bit. */
00320     sleep_ms(DELAY_WRITE);
00321     
00322     free(outData);
00323 }
